title: Benz Patent-Motorwagen
text: Carl Benz patents the first automobile in Mannheim, Germany. The three-wheeled Motorwagen becomes the world's first production automobile.

title: Maybach's Spray-Nozzle Carburetor
text: Wilhelm Maybach invents the spray-nozzle carburetor, enabling more efficient fuel combustion.

title: Mercedes 35 HP
text: Daimler-Motoren-Gesellschaft introduces the Mercedes 35 HP, setting new standards for power and speed.

title: Bosch Magneto Ignition
text: Robert Bosch perfects the magneto ignition system, improving reliability and performance.

title: Daimler-Benz Merger
text: Daimler and Benz merge to form Daimler-Benz AG, creating the Mercedes-Benz brand.

title: Volkswagen Beetle
text: Ferdinand Porsche designs the Volkswagen Beetle, which becomes one of the best-selling cars of all time.

title: Porsche 911 Launch
text: Porsche unveils the 911, an icon of sports car engineering that remains in production today.

title: BMW M Division
text: BMW establishes its Motorsport division (BMW M), focusing on high-performance vehicles.

title: ABS Technology
text: Bosch introduces the first electronic Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) for production cars.

title: ESP (Electronic Stability Program)
text: Bosch and Mercedes-Benz pioneer ESP, dramatically improving vehicle safety.

title: BMW i3 Electric
text: BMW launches the i3, a fully electric city car with carbon fiber construction.

title: Volkswagen ID.3 & ID.4
text: Volkswagen's MEB platform brings mass-market electric vehicles to Europe.

title: Mercedes EQS
text: Mercedes-Benz EQS sets new standards for luxury electric sedans with over 700 km range.
